intro: Boehmeria longispica, commonly known as the longispicous nettle, is a flowering plant belonging to the Urticaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and alternate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, and it is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. Boehmeria longispica is valued for its fibrous stalks, which have been used in traditional crafts and textiles. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and sustainable resource management.
